revised_title: John Alfred Valentine Butler: A Life in Science and Service
tldr: This biographical memoir recounts the life of John Alfred Valentine Butler, a distinguished chemist and authority on chemical thermodynamics. Born in 1899, Butler's early life was spent in a farming family in Gloucestershire, England. He pursued various interests, including engineering and pharmacy, before joining the military during World War I. While serving in the army, Butler continued to read and study, developing his expertise in science. After the war, he went on to make significant contributions to the field of chemical thermodynamics. This memoir highlights Butler's life, interests, and achievements.
